intro: Deiregyne alinae, commonly known as the Malagasy starfish plant, is a unique succulent native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped flowers. The plant features fleshy, cylindrical stems that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid conditions. Its flowers, which appear in clusters, are typically yellow or orange, adding a striking visual element to its appearance. Deiregyne alinae is a low-growing plant that prefers well-drained soil and full sunlight.
